files.description: Defines the canonical ID convention (study_id and effect_id formats), validation helpers, and shared constants used identically across CSV and JSONL.
Implements a CLI script that loads CSV and JSONL, validates IDs, checks cross-file mismatches, and emits clear actionable error messages with exit codes.
Passing demo CSV fixture containing study_id and effect_id columns that fully match the JSONL fixture under the shared ID convention.
Passing demo JSONL fixture with records whose study_id and effect_id match the passing CSV fixture exactly under the shared ID convention.
Failing demo CSV fixture intentionally containing an ID-format violation and an ID pair not present in the JSONL to trigger mismatch errors.
Failing demo JSONL fixture intentionally missing a CSV ID pair and including an extra unmatched ID pair to demonstrate bidirectional mismatch reporting.
Project documentation describing the ID convention, input schemas for CSV/JSONL, and example commands demonstrating both passing and failing fixture runs with expected errors.

missionDescription: Define an ID convention (e.g., study_id, effect_id) used identically in CSV and JSONL, implement a mismatch-checker script, and include a demo fixture that intentionally fails (plus a passing fixture) with clear error messages.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Adds integrity constraints across the meta-analysis workflow by linking extraction rows, taxonomy annotations, and preregistration fields via stable IDs; prevents silent join/key errors that undermine...
